SAFE Foundation are a local NGO,

But just come back from Uganda,
it was the last, oh God, three weeks ago,
two and a half weeks ago,
where we were there to build clay ovens
in a small community in Tororo in Uganda.
Clay ovens which they can bake bread
and cook food within it.
So we constructed them.
What was really nice that we went there
and it was a completed job,
as opposed to going in making something happen,
but it never quite, it came to the end
and never quite finished the project or what have you.
This was completely done,
and the onus is on the builders who watched us
and were taught how to make it to make more.
And also the onus is on the community to actually use them.
So it's a handover and it's a job well done all around.
So it was a pat on the back for everyone really.
But it's, like I say,
I've been on different community projects
where you go over there and it wasn't quite complete
and then you leave it
and then you come back in the same as you left it.
So that was nice.
And on top of that,
I went round photographing as well,
